title.narrative: CHILD RIGHTS MONITORING

description.narrative: Effective mechanisms for monitoring child rights are developed and used by the state institutions, local authorities, civil society and professionals, which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Private Sector Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, child rights are monitored, communicated and promoted through enhanced partnerships with state institutions, civil society, media, private sector, children and adolescents, and Bulgaria increasingly contributes to the advancement of child rights globally.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Effective mechanisms for monitoring child rights are developed and used by the state institutions, local authorities, civil societyand professionals

description.narrative: Continuos;;monitoring of situation of children in Bulgaria ensured, with a special focus on most vulnerable children and families; regular exchange of information and support for monitoring and ;reporting under UN monitoring instruments; Successfully; implemented monitoring and advocacy activities with Ombudsman Office with an emphasis on the impact of the COVID-19; Fruitful ;cooperation in terms of CRM with National Statistical Office, EU FRA, ;State Agency for Child Protection, SAR; improved administrative data systems on child protection and refugees; situation of refugee and migrant children regularly monitored and reported; enhanced capacity of NGOs to monitor and promote children&39;s rights. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2022

title.narrative: Ombudsman Office works in compliance with the Paris Principles and is a full member of ENOC and periodically monitors and reports on the situation of the most vulnerable children(52361), Text
NSI produced data on children are disaggregated in line with CRC concluding observations (CRC/C/BGR/CO/3-5)(52360), Text
